clinical_study.brief_title: Palliative and End-of-life Care in Advanced Dementia: Evaluation of a Program of Organization of Care in Long-term Care
clinical_study.official_title: Palliative and End-of-life Care in Advanced Dementia: Evaluation of a Program of Organization of Care in Long-term Care Settings

primary_outcome.description: Family Perception of Care Scale (FPCS): 25-item validated instrument including 4 components, yielding a score from 25 (negative perception) to 175 (highest positive perception of quality of palliative care)

primary_outcome.measure: Comfort scale in last two weeks of life
primary_outcome.description: Comfort Assessment in Dying with Dementia (CAD-EOL): 14-item validated instrument including 4 sub-scales, yielding a score from 14 (low comfort level) to 42 (highest comfort level).

study_pop.textblock: Residents in long term care settings

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Residents with advanced dementia with a score of 7 on the Reisberg scale
